title: Distance formula
speech: The distance formula is  the square root of parentheses, x sub 2 minus x sub 1,  squared plus, parentheses, y sub 2 minus y sub 1,  squared end root .
pacedSpeech: The distance formula is   the square root of , x sub 2 minus x sub 1,  squared plus, , y sub 2 minus y sub 1,  squared end root

title: Plug in
text: Plug in the values for the equation. Choose a point to be the $$x_2$$ and $$y_2$$ pair, and use the other as the $$x_1$$ and $$y_1$$ pair. We get $$\sqrt{{\left(5-\left(-1\right)\right)}^2+{\left(-5-3\right)}^2}=\sqrt{100}$$.
speech: Plug in the values for the equation. Choose a point to be the  x sub 2  and  y sub 2  pair, and use the other as the  x sub 1  and  y sub 1  pair. We get  the square root of parentheses, 5 minus negative 1,  squared plus, parentheses, negative 5 minus 3,  squared end root is equal to, the square root of 100 .
pacedSpeech: Plug in the values for the equation. Choose a point to be the   x sub 2
pair, and use the other as the   x sub 1
pair. We get   the square root of , 5 minus negative 1,  squared plus, , negative 5 minus 3,  squared end root is equal to, the square root of 100

title: Simplify
text: Simplify the answer into one term. $$\sqrt{100}=10$$
speech: Simplify the answer into one term. , the square root of 100 is equal to 10
pacedSpeech: Simplify the answer into one term.  , the square root of 100 is equal to 10
